title: @RiotRepertoir, do you have a minute to talk about Warwick?
body:
Warwick is my first buy and favorite character. I'm seeing a lot of characters getting updates and I where they are going and would love if my favorite outdated wolf-man could get some updates. Not something quite Sion like but more Gangplank or Fiora like. 

Is there any hope for Warwick to get an update soon? I think he could be retooled to be a juggernaut?

Also if you do reply to this thread would you like to hear some ideas I have?

Thank you and continue to do what you do man.

I like it. Would need tweaks, but as a one-time WW player, I like where this is going.

Also this is a crazy idea. But what if his E became his ult or passive? Instead of movespeed buffs, have significant lifesteal vs. low health enemies. He already has an assassin theme with his ult, why not go full ham with a lifesteal assassin?

The rest of his kit can be some sort of way of slowly whittling down high health enemies to get to the 'ham' point. Some sort of melee poke like Fiora has, possibly current health based? His Q could be a 2 charge current health dash which lets him dash to the other side of an enemy, hit them a few times, then dash back out. Then W and E assist his survivability/damage somehow.

If he gets caught by full health enemies and his escape is blocked, should just be dead. But should be able to sustain for ages vs. an entire low-health team. Like a melee Karthus, who outsustains your damage instead of straight up killing you when you're below a certain threshold.

Not as big of a WW fan as others probably are, but I will point out one thing: E is a cool thematic spell, definitely! ... except when he can use the movement speed to run away, then you have a werewolf being fueled by his bloodlust to get _as far away from the fight as possible_, and that's kind of pathetic-looking.

Long story short, in any hypothetical WW rework that kept the ability, I'd hope it would change so he only gets the movement speed running towards 'marked' enemies, for thematic reasons.
His e is probably the most unique mechanic he has in his kit now that I think about it.

I'd like to know your take on his kit around his E. As this ability is a favorite of mine.

If you don't mind me chiming in, I've got some light to shed on that question. I've mained Warwick for a few years now, so I should hope I can. 

Personally, it's that fantasy of making people afraid of being alone. Of them knowing that you're coming for them and them alone and there's nothing they, or anyone else can do about it. Help is so far away, and it won't reach them in time. 

The big problem with this right now is that the main way to do that is with damage, and a lot of Warwick's damage got nerfed fairly hard. Not to mention, damage means you need to be ahead. Without being at least somewhat ahead, Warwick doesn't have terrifying levels of damage. Of course, that's also very bad for game health, for a bruiser like Warwick to have terrifying levels of damage. 

If I had to make a suggestion, I'd say explore the direction of increasing Warwick's single target effectiveness. I know Poppy's ultimate is a travesty, but this kind of idea, that a champion is coming for you and can't be stopped, is the kind of fantasy that Warwick thrives on. It might be possible to make it so that Warwick has to commit to going after a single champion, which would increase his effectiveness against that one champion. 

I don't recall which rioter posted the kit way back when Warwick was getting looked at, but it was a travesty. Don't pursue that kind of path forward, please.

I've been playing warwick since season 1 and I've got a pretty good take as to what I like and what I would love to see. Mainly need new animations :P
For me warwick identity is that of a blood craving werewolf, relentlessly hunting his prey. A bruiser kind of champion who can chase down fleeing oponnents and maul down almost anyone in 1v1 with his high sustain. He should stick to his target and be able to take advantage of bad positioning to suppress a key enemy (ult). 

Passive: I think the passive just need to be a bit more bloody visual wise not some green healing effect you would expect to see on soraka. Otherwise, it's fine as additional on hit damage since warwick always was a "on-hit effect" champ.

Q: An interesting change would be a lunge/small leap and to match the werewolf team he should bite the target over clawing him. The range should remains near the same, the damage mechanic of whichever is greater is a pretty good way to gauge the power I think it should stay whatever happen. Now this could also apply On-hit which would go well with the on-hit identity of warwick. Also the healing

By the way, even without any functionality change the current Q would fit on a new kit.

W: Now that's the ability I think needs to go, something I would love to see is some kind of fear, maybe some kind of "empowered basic attack" or a clawing attack akin to current Q. Of course the fear should not be very long, more like 0.3 seconds but should also apply a small slow and some additional damage. The cooldown should be significant enough.

E: The most awesome ability of all, just like repertoire I agree that to play with the fear factor would be awesome, maybe an increase in range to all abilities toward market target (greater ult range would be scary as hell) and/or increased attack speed when attacking a marked target (a buff that would last 1-2 seconds and refresh on every attack).

R: Now visually very underwhelming instead of a teleport warwick should leap at 1000+ missile speed and be completely unstoppable during the leap. I tink the supress should stay and this ability should pretty much stay the same or very similar. No matter what, it should in opinion still apply multiple time on-hit.

What I think this would achieve: Put more importance on warwick as a hunter/pick maker and keep him as a very strong duelist.

Something that I would see as fun, but might be unviable overpower or just unfun is some kind of life steal from total damage done on auto attack, which would include on-hit somewhere on his kit, it could be on his ult (and during his ult only) and replace to additionnal life steal gain.

I would love to know what other think of this.
